item.title: school vacations make broadway box offices work overtime
item.description: nearly a dozen musicals break the $1 million mark for the week.

item.title: kremlin to putin: start state board purge by july 1
item.description: president dmitry medvedev gave prime minister vladimir putin a july 1 deadline on saturday to begin the process of removing russian ministers from state firm boards, a move which could clip the wings of top putin allies.

item.title: wildfire consumes homes in eastern arizona
item.description: a stubborn 5-day-old wildfire that has forced hundreds of people to flee their homes in eastern arizona grew dramatically to 106,000 acres on friday, claiming as many as seven dwellings, officials said.

item.title: commodities gain as inflation worries take hold
item.description: investors are concerned about a split on the federal reserve policy committee over tightening credit, which is leading to higher prices for commodities.

item.title: ftc and justice department mull google antitrust probe
item.description: u.s. antitrust regulators may investigate google inc's dominance of the web search industry, and will settle on the agency to launch a probe once scrutiny into the company's plan to buy ita software is done, a source told reuters on tuesday.

item.title: fourth film is so unoriginal you could 'scream'
item.description: the best parts of 'scream 4' wink at the first three movies in wes craven's franchise.

item.title: kemba walker expected to make call on nba draft tuesday
item.description: kemba walker is expected to announce tuesday whether he will stay at connecticut or skip his senior season to enter the nba draft.

item.title: pirates free panamanian tanker, seize bulk carrier
item.description: somali pirates freed a panama-flagged chemical tanker and its mostly tunisian crew on thursday after payment of a ransom, pirates and the tunisian tap news agency said.

item.description: general motors ceo dan akerson received compensation of just over $2.5 million last year, mainly for his four months as the company's top executive, ...

item.title: in lockout, a close eye falls on the nfl network
item.description: the nfl network is the first of the league-owned cable channels to cover a labor dispute involving itself, raising the question of how much journalistic freedom it can have.

item.title: in yemen, opposition encourages protesters
item.description: a show of support came a day after the worst violence by government supporters since the protests began about a month ago.

item.title: washington: house votes to limit access to abortion
item.description: on a 251-to-175 vote, the house approved a bill prohibiting federal money to be used for insurance plans that cover abortions.

item.title: wildfire consumes homes in eastern arizona
item.description: a stubborn 5-day-old wildfire that has forced hundreds of people to flee their homes in eastern arizona grew dramatically to 106,000 acres on friday, claiming as many as seven dwellings, officials said.

item.title: barry bonds trial: former friend talks steroid use, girlfriends
item.description: steve hoskins was once a close friend and business associate of barry bonds.

item.title: a history of royal nuptials
item.description: yes, william and kate are the main attraction, but there were plenty of headline-grabbing royal weddings before them.

item.title: car bomb destroys police station in pakistan, six dead
item.description: a suicide bomber drove an explosives-packed car into a police station on wednesday as the taliban intensified attacks against pakistan's security forces after the killing of al qaeda leader osama bin laden.

item.title: oman detained up to 60 during clashes: witnesses
item.description: security forces detained between 50 and 60 protesters in clashes on friday in the omani industrial town of sohar, witnesses said.

item.title: c.i.a. flashes its green credentials
item.description: the c.i.a. says its shredding and burning of classified documents is not only safeguarding secrets, but also protecting the planet by generating steam and saving energy.

item.title: stage resuscitation for career-challenged celebrities
item.description: there are plenty of stage roles tailor-made for stars with particular skills and images who are in search of redemption.

item.title: medical marijuana superstore opens on arizona
item.description: some local wags are calling it the "wal-mart of weed" or "home depot."

item.title: study questions heartburn drugs for kids
item.description: acid-suppressing drugs like prilosec and prevacid may not be much help for infants with troublesome acid reflux, and there's too little evidence that they help older children and teenagers, a new research review concludes.

item.title: middle east: egypt: blast near pyramids
item.description: a small bomb exploded near egypt's pyramids outside cairo on wednesday, badly injuring three peddlers who the police said were trying to open the device's casing.

item.title: davis cup throws out spain appeal of u.s. surface
item.description: davis cup organizers rejected spain's appeal on thursday, and said the united states' choice of a hardcourt surface for the quarterfinal in july in austin, tex., met regulations.

item.title: masters in past, mcilroy brings good memories to charlotte
item.description: horrifying? yes. haunting? not a chance. rory mcilroy insisted tuesday that as ghastly as his final-round, back-nine masters collapse was it ...

item.title: rangers' callahan out with broken leg
item.description: the new york rangers' playoff drive took a major hit with the loss of ryan callahan, who is out indefinitely because of a broken right leg.

item.title: bmw shows off more fuel-efficient new 1 series
item.description: the smallest bmw is the usa is getting an upgrade.

item.title: buffett says mistakes were made in handling sokol
item.description: warren buffett believes david sokol clearly violated berkshire hathaway's ethical standards when he bought stock in lubrizol before recommending ...

item.title: farm boom missing main street
item.description: near-record corn and soybean prices are driving a booming farm economy, but nearby towns decline.

item.title: ireland may need more eu/imf cash: minister
item.description: ireland may have to ask for another loan from the european union and international monetary fund because it will struggle to return to debt markets to raise funds next year, a government minister said on sunday.

item.title: greece denies missed fiscal targets as eu bickers
item.description: greece's hopes of averting default dimmed on saturday as fears grew the country may have missed fiscal targets set by its lenders while euro zone policymakers bickered on how to respond to the deepening crisis.

item.title: mavericks take on the heat, and the curse, in title series
item.description: when the nba finals start in miami on tuesday, the mavericks will become the latest team from dallas to take on the so-called 'curse of the crease' when they face the heat in game one of the best-of-seven series.

item.title: underdog mosley says pacquiao win would be career best
item.description: shane mosley feels a victory over wbo welterweight champion manny pacquiao on saturday would be his biggest ever despite a glittering career that includes world titles in three weight classes.

item.title: indians 1, red sox 0: red sox slip to 0-6
item.description: the red sox lost their sixth in a row when the cleveland indians squeezed home the only run in the eighth inning, then trapped pinch-runner darnell mcdonald off second base for the final out.

item.title: msnbc's chris licht to join cbs news
item.description: the behind-the-scenes member of the "morning joe" band, chris licht, is leaving msnbc and becoming the vice president of programming at cbs news.

item.title: technicals have orlando's howard smelling conspiracy
item.description: orlando center dwight howard believes his 18 technicals mean referees are out to get him.

item.title: levee breach in southwest iowa forces mandatory evacuation
item.description: officials in a rural corner of southwest iowa ordered residents to evacuate on sunday after a levee on the flood-swollen missouri river broke.

item.title: business briefing | telecom: earnings outlook lifts shares of marvell technology
item.description: the marvell technology group gave a positive earnings forecast and said sales of smartphone chips in china were beginning to improve, setting off an 11 percent gain in its share price.

item.title: "wave to pay" chipmaker hires ipo banks: sources
item.description: inside secure, a chipmaker hoping to benefit from technology that allows shoppers to buy goods with the wave of a smartphone, has hired two banks for a paris flotation, people familiar with the matter said.

item.title: leonard green considering bid for bj's wholesale club
item.description: investment firm leonard green amp;amp; partners is considering an offer to acquire warehouse club operator bj's wholesale club.

item.title: madoff victim seeks divorce do-over
item.description: when steven simkin and laura blank divorced and split their assets, the largest chunk of money was invested with bernard madoff, and mr. simkin is now suing to revise the deal.

item.title: google, facebook warn on internet rules at e-g8
item.description: google inc chairman eric schmidt and facebook founder mark zuckerberg warned governments to tread lightly on internet regulation because moves to tame its rough edges risked hurting its virtues.

item.title: 216,000 jobs added; unemployment rate dips to 8.8%
item.description: the unemployment rate fell to a two-year low of 8.8% in march and companies added workers at the fastest two-month pace since before the recession ...

item.title: class-action lawsuit says utah immigration law violates civil rights
item.description: two civil rights organizations are trying to block a law that grants the police in utah new powers to question people about their immigration status.

item.title: kazakh leader to tighten grip in early election
item.description: kazakhstan holds an early presidential election on sunday that is widely expected to hand president nursultan nazarbayev another five years at the helm of central asia's largest economy.

item.title: greece moves on austerity deal, opposition wants more
item.description: greece appears to have agreed a tax cut with its international lenders, aimed at forging a broad consensus for more austerity to avoid a debt default, but the opposition said on tuesday this would still not win its support.

item.title: eu racing to draft second greek bailout
item.description: the european union is racing to draft a second bailout package for greece to release vital loans next month and avert the risk of the euro zone country defaulting, eu officials said on monday.

item.title: will smith's massive trailer sent packing
item.description: the star's tricked-out trailer has drawn ire from new york residents.

item.title: arab web clampdown hurts own economies: google's schmidt
item.description: arab leaders were wrong to block internet access in an effort to quell popular revolts as such moves only hurt their own economies, google chairman eric schmidt said on thursday.

item.title: bulls' defense is devilishly familiar to the heat's james
item.description: the game plan of chicago coach tom thibodeau was a key to limiting lebron james to 15 points in a runaway game 1 victory.

item.title: secondmarket seeks guidance from u.s. regulator: wsj
item.description: secondmarket, which offers an online platform to match buyers and sellers in privately held companies, is seeking u.s. approval to handle those transactions, according to the wall street journal on sunday.

item.title: tunis court confirms dissolution of ben ali party
item.description: a tunisian court has rejected an appeal by the party of former president zine al-abidine ben ali against a ruling that it be dissolved, the official tap news agency said monday.

item.title: 78 die in yemen blast that increases fear of chaos
item.description: yemen's chaos deepened on monday when people looting a munitions factory set off an accidental explosion that killed at least 78 in an area torn ...

item.title: apollo earnings up, in first report since ipo
item.description: private equity firm apollo global management llc's first-quarter earnings rose fivefold from a year earlier as the value of its investments increased, in its first quarterly report since its march ipo.

item.title: president heads west to sell his deficit plan
item.description: the trip is mr. obama's first since the unofficial start of his re-election campaign in chicago.

item.title: trial of white man accused of black church fire begins
item.description: a pastor testified on monday in the federal trial of a white man accused of torching his mostly black church to protest barack obama's election as the nation's first black president.

item.title: rate on 30-year mortgage falls to 4.80%
item.description: the rate on the 30-year mortgage fell last week, staying below 5%. but low rates have done little to lift the struggling housing market.

item.title: james helps heat burn bright in finals opener
item.description: lebron james took the opening step toward winning his first championship by leading the miami heat to a 92-84 victory over the dallas mavericks in game one of the nba finals on tuesday.

item.title: sharp suspends two tv panel plants as demand tumbles
item.description: sharp corp has suspended production at two japanese liquid crystal display (lcd) panel plants until early may as it confronts slumping domestic demand for televisions and shortages of a gas used in panel production, the company said on monday.

item.title: photo gallery: our most anticipated games of e3 2011
item.description: so, what games are on game hunters' radar? check out the photo gallery posted here highlighting our 20 most anticipated games of e3 2011.

item.title: with mail bombs, old firm rivalry crosses the line
item.description: in a season of unprecedented tension in scottish soccer, the threshold of tolerance looks to have finally been crossed after the police intercepted nail bombs sent to celtic manager neil lennon.

item.title: aig sells off asbestos risk to berkshire hathaway
item.description: american international group inc will transfer its troublesome asbestos risk to berkshire hathaway inc , relieving it of a book of business that has cost it billions of dollars, the bailed-out insurer said on wednesday.

item.title: toyota to cut north american output next week
item.description: toyota motor corp will start cutting production at its north american plants next week to adjust for supply disruptions stemming from the march 11 earthquake in japan, the company said on friday.

item.title: chicago news cooperative: a tea party congressman cultivates his base
item.description: representative joe walsh, a newly elected republican, held his 20th town-hall-style meeting this week, and it offered a lesson in where tea party partisans currently stand.

item.title: in massachusetts, long waits for doctor visits
item.description: almost everyone in massachusetts has health insurance under a state mandate, but many doctors do not accept the subsidized insurance programs available to low-income residents, a new study shows.

item.title: u.s. seeks tax client data from hsbc india
item.description: the u.s. department of justice is seeking records about american clients of hsbc in india who might be evading taxes, broadening the government's probe of banks suspected of helping tax dodgers.

item.description: former imf chief is indicted and faces 24-hour confinement in nyc apartment until trial.

item.description: top seed caroline wozniacki finally found a way to beat spaniard maria jose martinez sanchez with a ruthless 6-1 6-3 demolition in the third round of the indian wells wta tournament on monday.

item.title: jankovic's title defense ended by fellow serb ivanovic
item.description: holder jelena jankovic was eliminated from the indian wells wta tournament by former champion and fellow serb ana ivanovic on tuesday, losing 6-4 6-2 in the fourth round.

item.description: top seed caroline wozniacki barely raised a sweat as she pummeled american wildcard sloane stephens 6-3 6-2 in the second round of the indian wells wta tournament on saturday.

item.title: in new egypt, police talk to human rights groups
item.description: egypt's police, whose credibility was shattered for using excessive force against anti-government protesters who toppled president hosni mubarak from power, will give more focus to human rights, the government said on friday.

item.description: a panel of experts that reviewed the psychiatric records of army researcher bruce ivins said it agreed with the justice department's finding that he committed a series of deadly anthrax attacks in 2001.

item.title: thousands expected to honor fallen police as death rate climbs
item.description: law enforcement fatalities for 2011 are on track to be one of the highest in recent years, with the count hitting 71 this week as survivors and friends of the fallen prepared for an annual candlelight vigil.

item.description: the kentucky derby lost one of its major drawcards on friday when uncle mo was scratched from the $2.2 million classic on the eve of the race because of a mystery illness.

item.description: ron gardenhire's twins are 6-31 against the yankees in the bronx since he took over in 2002.

item.title: airbus under investigation over rio-paris crash
item.description: european planemaker airbus was placed under investigation on thursday for the 2009 crash of a flight between rio de janeiro and paris that killed 228 people, airbus chief executive thomas enders said.

item.title: snowmelt, rain worsen flooding in northern plains
item.description: historic flooding in the missouri river basin spurred voluntary evacuations in north dakota on monday, while in montana emergency workers ferried food and water to a town cut off by flood waters.

item.description: the food and drug administration says some chicken meat may contain arsenic, but the amounts are too small to be harmful.

item.description: morocco's interior ministry says three people have been detained in the recent cafe bombing in marrakech that killed 16 people.

item.title: the lede: egypt holds 136 for israeli protest
item.description: the egyptian military could bring charges against 136 people arrested during a protest outside the israeli embassy in cairo on sunday, including two prominent bloggers.

item.title: barcelona 1, real madrid 1: tie sends barcelona to the final
item.description: barcelona tied real madrid, 1-1, and advanced to the final of the european champions league with a 3-1 edge in aggregate goals.

item.title: china arrests fourth dissident in "jasmine" crackdown
item.description: chinese authorities have arrested a veteran dissident, zhu yufu, on subversion charges, his ex-wife and a friend said on wednesday, making him the fourth activist known to have been arrested and likely to face trial in a crackdown on dissent.

item.title: charlie sheen loses custody battle for kids: reports
item.description: former "two and a half men" star charlie sheen on tuesday lost a bid to win sole custody of his young sons from ex-wife brooke mueller, celebrity news website tmz.com reported.

item.title: jennifer aniston and justin theroux?
item.description: as her new, topless ad for smartwater arrives, so do reports that she and actor justin theroux are more than friends.

item.title: pacquiao's trainer to prepare u.s. boxers for 2012 games
item.description: manny pacquiao's trainer freddie roach has formed a partnership with the united states olympic committee and usa boxing to help prepare american boxers for the 2012 london games.

item.title: ex-officer set to win narrow victory in peru
item.description: ollanta humala's victory over keiko fujimori would be a rebuke of the economic model that has driven robust growth in peru, even as millions of citizens who are mired in poverty have felt left out.

item.title: arizona governor makes colt revolver official state gun
item.description: the colt revolver, a historic remnant from the shoot-em-up days of the old west, is now arizona's official gun.
